I spent last October through December mostly living in hotels and eating in decadent restaurants devoted to gluttony. 30 new pounds, mostly in my gut and face. 
 
 On 1-15 I started a new diet recommended by my doctor (my first ever diet). Instead of the 2800 calories suitable for my frame and mass, she recommended 1800 calories, three meals daily, eliminating only fried foods and sugar while reducing bread/dairy products to a minimum. That plus my usual three days (two-hours every-other day) at the health club. By 3-20, I was back to my normal weight, often even using 270 of those daily calories for beer. If one doesn't want to see a doctor, spending a little time on the Internet will quickly provide a healthy, well-balanced diet with all the calories one needs for frame and mass. Just reduce the calories by approximately 30%.
 
 The fad diets, as any MD or health club dietitian can tell you, are, for most people, a sure method of repeated failure. They deprive the body of certain chemicals during the weight loss period. When the diet is abandoned the body has a new mission, replacing those chemicals and adding more in the form of fatty tissue in case that trick is repeated. The Atkins Diet is probably the most well known for removing 20 lbs and replacing it with 30 as many times as one wants to repeat it. 
 
 Incidentally, exercise alone doesn't shed weight, it only changes fat tissue to muscle tissue.
